Geography.Location: Southern Africa, between the Zambezi and Limpopo Rivers
Geography.Topography: Mostly over 1,000 feet above sea level with a broad ridge running across the country

Judicial Branch.Judge Selection and Term: Appointed by President, serve until age 65-70, Constitutional Court judges serve 15-year terms

Political Parties: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front or ZANU-PF
Zimbabwe African Peoples Union or ZAPU

Challenges: High public and external debt burden
Economy.Economic Overview: Depends heavily on mining and agriculture. Experienced real growth post-2010, followed by a decline due to various economic challenges.

History.Early Civilizations: Bantu people built Great Zimbabwe in the 9th century, leading to the Kingdom of Zimbabwe and later Rozvi and Mutapa empires.

Colonial History.Rhodesia Region: Demarcated by the British South Africa Company in 1890, covering Mashonaland and later Matabeleland.
Colonial History.Southern Rhodesia: Became a self-governing British colony in 1923.
Colonial History.Rhodesian UDI: White minority government declared independence in 1965 as Rhodesia.

Membership: Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa

Symbols.Flag: Seven equal horizontal bands of green, yellow, red, black, red, yellow, and green with a white triangle and Zimbabwe bird.

National Anthem.Title: Blessed be the land of Zimbabwe

Geographical Features.Relief: Broad ridge running across the country

Cultural Aspects.Languages: 16 official languages, including English, Shona, and Ndebele
Cultural Aspects.Ethnic Composition: Majority Shona, followed by Northern Ndebele and other minorities

Economic Indicators.GDP Growth: 6.5% in 2022, driven by agricultural production and mineral exports
Economic Indicators.Inflation: Triple-digit inflation constraining private sector demand
Economic Indicators.Fiscal Deficit: Contained in 2022, with increased government spending

Challenges.Economic: High inflation, exchange rate instability, high public and external debt
Challenges.Social: High rate of poverty and vulnerability, impacted by inflation and agricultural dependency
